pages.text: The art of making cheese dates back over 7,000 years ago. This process has remained relatively the same over the ages.

pages.title: Summary
pages.text: $(br)1. Make cultured milk in the mixing vat$(br2)2. Make cheese curds$(br2)3. Drain the cheese curds$(br2)4. Press the curds into a wheel$(br2)5. Age your cheese wheel

pages.title: Cultured Milk
pages.text: In order to make cultured milk, your mixing vat must have a heat source underneath it. Once the mixing vat is heated, add 4 buckets of Milk, 1 bucket of Rennet and 1 starter culture. Then activate the vat with a wooden stick to start the process. Once the cultured milk is developed, remove the rennet with a bucket. This will leave 4 buckets of cultured milk in your mixing vat.

pages.title: Cheese Curds
pages.text: Next, add ingredients to make cheese curds of your intended cheese.

pages.title: Ingredients
pages.text: Cheddar Cheese$(li)1 Salt$(li)1 Orange Dye$(br2)Gorgonzola Cheese$(li)1 Salt$(li)1 Grape$(br2)Emmentaler Cheese$(li)1 Salt$(li)1 Wheat

pages.title: Ingredients
pages.text: Appenzeller Cheese$(li)1 Salt$(li)1 Grape$(li)1 Bayanus Yeast$(br2)Asiago Cheese$(li)1 Salt$(li)1 Salt$(li)1 Yellow Dye$(br2)Parmesan Cheese$(li)1 Salt$(li)1 White Dye

pages.title: Ingredients
pages.text: Monterey Cheese$(li)1 Salt$(li)1 Red Dye$(br2)Provolone Cheese$(li)1 Salt$(li)1 Yellow Dye$(br2)Gouda Cheese$(li)1 Salt$(li)1 Gray Dye

pages.title: Draining Curds
pages.text: Now that you have cheese curds, attach them to the underside of a block to drain.

pages.title: Cheese Press
pages.text: Finally, you will need to place the drained curds into a $(l:milk/mixing_vat)Cheese Press$(/l).

pages.title: Ingredients
pages.text: Casu Marzu Cheese$(li)1 Salt$(li)1 Rotten Flesh

pages.title: Cheese Aging
pages.text: In order to make cheese editable, you will need to age your cheese. This is done by simply placing your cheese wheel down and waiting for it to age.$(br2)Once the cheese wheel has become aged, it will change colors.
